messages.body:
Received: from dedi449

Date:Fri, 19 Oct 2007 

Hello Friend,

I am MICHAEL HARNI.A former government official of Liberia. Following the exit of president Charles Taylor of Liberia from power under a WestAfrican brokered peace agreement, led by Nigerian President Olusegun Obasanjo he was granted asylum by the Nigerian Government. In my position as the Financial Secretary to the President and close confidant, I left for Nigeria in his Encourage.
My country has been engulfed in Protracted Civil war with rebels controlling some parts of the country. During the war, President Taylor disbursed large sums of Monies to buy the loyalty of the entire cabinet, and I can say with all modesty that I was one of the Chief Beneficiaries of this disbursement. This is aside from monies I used my official position to acquire while in office. 
Since we relocated to Calabar, Southern Nigeria all has been well, but with the recent indictment of former President Taylor by the war crime tribunal sitting in Sierra Leone and confirmed reports of a dedicated fund by the American Government to capture him in order to face war crime charges have now decided to leave the country. Presently I have funds totaling United State $15,000,000.(Fifteen Million US Dollars) Which I intend to move oversea for investment and spend the rest of my life there with my family. This transaction is risk-free as all local arrangement has been made. 
If you are prepared to assist to work with me I require the following: Your Full Name and Address, Your Private Telephone, Fax Number and private Email Address. As Compensation for your assistance you will 
retain 15% of the Total sum, While 5% will be mapped out for local and International expenses. Though we are not known to each other, I strongly believe that through this transaction we would be able to forge a mutually 
beneficial relationship between us, now and in the future. Finally, the success of thistransaction will depend to a great extent on mutual trust,secrecy and Confidentiality from you.

I await your response by E-mail:-harnimichael@gmail.com
Best Regards,
MICHEAL HARNI.

Hello Friend,

THANK YOU FOR YOUR MAIL, I AM SENDING THIS MESSAGE TO FURTHER ENLIGHTEN YOU ON THE POSITION OF THINGS AS THEY STAND RIGHT NOW.

LIKE I SAID IN MY FIRST MAIL, I AM MR.MICHEAL HARNI, A LIBERIAN AND FINANCIAL SECRETARY TO FORMER PRESIDENT CHARLES TAYLOR OF LIBERIA. DUE TO THE WAR PROBLEMS IN LIBERIA , FORMER PRESIDENT CHARLES TAYLOR AND I ARE SEEKING REFUGE IN NIGERIA PRESENTLY. YOU MUST UNDERSTAND THAT IN Y PRESENT POSITION, I AM HANDICAPPED AND CANNOT DO ANYTHING UNTIL I HAVE THIS CASH SECURED SOMEWHERE SAFE AND WITH SOMEBODY RELIABLE WHO CAN MANAGE THE MONEY FOR ME. MY INTENTION IS TO LIVE THE REST OF MY LIFE IN YOUR COUNTRY AND THAT IS WHY I CONTACTED YOU FOR THIS ASSISTANCE.

I ALSO WANT YOU TO KNOW THAT A FRIENDS OF MINE HERE IN NIGERIA HAS INTRODUCED ME TO A DIPLOMAT THAT IS WILLING TO MOVE THE CONSIGNMENT TO YOUR DOOR STEP AT ANY TIME YOU SO DESIRE. 

PRIOR TO THE MOVEMENT OF THE CONSIGNMENT, I SHALL SEND YOU THE KEYS TO THE TRUNK BOX CONTAINING THE MONEY AND UPON ARRIVAL AT YOUR DESTINATION, YOU ARE SUPPOSED TO CHECK THE CONTENT OF THE TRUCK BOX AND ASCERTAIN THAT IT CONTAINS THE COMPLETE AMOUNT (US$15MILLION) BEFORE EFFECTING ANY DELIVERY CHARGES TO THE DIPLOMAT. 

YOU SHOULD NOTE THAT THE DELIVERY OFFICER WILL NOT NECESSARILY KNOW THE CONTENT OF THE TRUNK BOX FOR SECURITY REASONS. ALL THAT IS REQUIRED OF YOU IS SOMETHING WITH WHICH TO RECOGNISE YOU WHEN DELIVERY WILL BE MADE . YOU ARE REQUIRED TO SEND THE FOLLOW INFORMATION:

1. YOUR FULL NAME.......

2. YOUR FULL CONTACT ADDRESS.......

3. COUNTRY / CITY ..........

4.DRIVER'S LICENCE OR ANY OTHER FORM OF IDENTIFICATION) TELEPHONE NUMBER AND A COMPREHENSIVE ADDRESS OF WHERE THE DELIVERY WILL BE MADE.

I HAVE ATTACHED THE CERTIFICATE OF DEPOSIT,THE DIPLOMAT I.D CARD AND A PICTUREOF THE CONSIGNMENT TO YOU OK.
IF YOU ARE WILLING TO BE OF ASSISTANCE IN THIS REGARD, I SHALL GIVE YOU THE NAME OF THE DIPLOMAT AND HIS TEL. NO. SO THAT YOU CAN ESTABLISH CONTACT WITH HIM AND FAMILIARISE WITH HIM BEFORE HE ARRIVES YOUR COUNTRY.

YOU SHOULD HOWEVER HAVE IT IN MIND THAT I AM BANKING ON YOUR UTMOST HONESTY AND TRUSTWOTHINESS FOR THIS WHOLE TRANSACTION TO SUCCEED. 
I WILL LIKE YOU TO FORWARD TO ME YOUR IDENTIFICATION.

I AWAIT YOUR MOST URGENT RESPONSE AS I HOPE TO COMPLETE THIS WHOLE TRANSACTION WITHIN 14 DAYS.

Best Regards,

MR MICHEAL HARNI.

messages.body:
Hi, Michael,

I got your letter, and I don't know why you can't send your attachments again so I can at least see them! That wouldn't be too much trouble would it?

Here is my information, but you might think I'm not right for this partnership with you. I don't have too much spare time because I go to school, and I take care of my Gramma because I live with her. My Mom and Dad got divorced when Dad had to go to prison. He'll be out in about 40 more years, the judge said. Then Mom started to go out with other men, and then she ran off with some guy she met, and left me to live with Gramma. That was 4 years ago.

1. YOUR FULL NAME....... Amanda Arlene l'Egge

2. YOUR FULL CONTACT ADDRESS....... 2 Longgams Road

3. COUNTRY / CITY .......... Shankspony, Maryland, USA .

4.DRIVER'S LICENCE OR ANY OTHER FORM OF IDENTIFICATION).......As soon as we get a scanner, I'll send you a copy of my driver license, OK? Gramma says we can go to the store this weekend, and get it because of me needing one for school.

TELEPHONE NUMBER.......There's a problem with a telephone number, because I live at Gramma's house and she mostly answers the phone.

COMPREHENSIVE ADDRESS WHERE THE DELIVERY WILL BE MADE.......I suppose that would be the one I gave you. That's at my Gramma's house.

I'm in my room now, and using my own computer, so I don't have to worry about Gramma seeing anything between you and me. She's a little "funny" that way. She wants me to"stay away from all men, and that includes letters and phone calls, young lady!!!" (that's how she talks) until after I graduate from college, which will be in 14 months, because I'm taking accelerated courses.

Anyway, when I use my own computer, she can't see what I'm doing. She's really a cool old lady, but she doesn't want me to quit school, and since she's paying for my education, I guess I'll have to do what she says. Except on my own computer, (when she's sleeping or watching TV).

Now you can see why I can't give you our telephone number, but I could call you, if I had a cell phone, which I don't. Gramma says that a pager is all I need for the time being, and she's right. If she needs to call me, she calls that number, and I can call her back when I'm out of class. If I need to call her, I call her when I'm out of class.

Is this OK or do you want to find somebody else to help you?

Your friend, Amanda

messages.body:
Hi, Michael!

WOW! Two letters in one day! Gramma is taking a nap, so I can write to you. She will be getting up soon, so it will have to be short.

I can't call you, Michael. I don't have a mobile phone! I told you that. Cell phone is another name for mobile phone.

I didn't know you live in a refugee camp. That must be horrible for you, especially after being such a high-up official with President Charles Taylor. I am still afraid of him, now that you have my address at my Gramma's, he might get it, and come after me. He sure doesn't sound like a very nice man!!!

Another thing, when you first wrote, you said that my share would be 15% of the $15million dollars, and I was OK with that, over $2 million dollars for me! I could spend it on a whole bunch of stuff that I want. Now you say that I will be getting 40%, which is $6 million dollars! I am just AMAZED!!! What did I do to deserve this? I would have been happy with 15%! Are you ever generous! I'm just a little country girl in Maryland farm country, and next thing you know, I'll be rich!

This is soooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo cool!

Your friend, Amanda

Dear Michael Horni,

I just got home from school and when I checked my mail, I see I got two letters from you, and the first one is OK, but there are a few things in your second letter that I have to ask you about. I got that letter only 2 minutes later, so you must really type fast! WOW, am I impressed!


Keys? What do I need keys for?


Oh, you can't have a man come to our house! Especially an African diplomat! Gramma will set the dogs loose on him for sure, and he will be torn to shreds. She has 3 bull Mastifs and a Rottweiller, and they don't like men, and they really don't like black men. If he came in African clothes, there's no telling what the dogs would do. But they sure wouldn't like it, I know that! Tell the African diplomat to stay away!


What does that mean?


Why do you call me "Mr Michael" That's your name, mine is Amanda.
.

What keys? Keys for what? Is the trunk locked? (That wouldn't really be a problem, because Gramma has guns, and we could shoot the trunk open.)

I hope you and your family are doing OK on only $15 a day. That really isn't enough to live on. How many children do you have? How old are they?

As for the $300, if you don't have to send me the keys (remember I told you about the dogs and the guns?) and you don't even have to pay for shipping the trunk. Just have it sent COD (Collect On Delivery) and as soon as it gets here, we'll shoot it open, and pay the freight charges out of the trunk. Pretty simple.

Just make sure the FedEx truck is parked down the street, and it would be better to have a woman deliver the trunk, the dogs are OK with women. Send it COD, and everything will be just great!

This is sooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo super cool!

Your friend, Amanda

messages.body:
Dear Michael Harni,

I just have a few minutes to write before I have to go to my classes. I thought of something. Is all that $15million dollars in the trunk box, and am I supposed to remove only 40% and send you back the rest? That's a lot of trust you're putting on me. If I was a crook (which I'm NOT!!), I could just take all the money, and you would still be in the refuge camp, trying to live on $15 a day.

I just read your first letter again, and I guess you will come to America so we can split the money, but do you think we will just sit down at the table and count out your share, and my share? My Gramma won't put up with that, for sure! First of all, you wouldn't get past the dogs! Second, she wouldn't let you in the house, and she wouldn't let you talk to me, either! She's really protective of me.

The only thing I can think of is to tell Gramma that I want to get a part-time job after classes, and then when you get to America, maybe I could meet you at a restaurant or something, so we can figure this out?

I gotta go now, so I won't be late to class. My friend, Bonnie, who I ride with, will be picking me up in about a minute. Gotta go.

Your friend, Amanda

messages.body:
Wait 'til Monday morning to answer...

Hi, Michael!

I didn't get your letter till late last night, and I was soooooooo tired, I just went to bed. Some of my girlfriends and I went up to the mountain to ski, but there wasn't a whole lot of snow yet, so we went hiking instead. Just put the skis into the cabin room, and off we went! WOW, was it ever fun, and really tiring! We sure saw a lot of really neat nature stuff. We even saw a bear, and two deers.

Gramma asked me if there were any boys around, but I told her no, which was true. I just like to do stuff with my girlfriends mostly, because boys are so silly sometimes, and they like to try to do sex-things all the times. That could get me pregnant, and that would really make Gramma upset, and get me grounded for life! Now I live with her all the time, and like I told you, she is real protective of me, she wants me to get an education, so I don't "end up like your parents!!!" She says that a lot.

Anyways, I have a couple of minutes before I go to school to write to you, I got the feeling that you are worried about me, but don't worry about me, because I am OK. I have to go to classes today, but I will go to the college work center and see if there is any part time job that I can do. I have had some experiences in office work, so maybe I can do that part time, in some office near Gramma's house.

Gotta go, Bonnie is almost here and I have to go brush my teeth, then off we go to classes.

Love, Amanda

Lad doesn't waste much time, does he?

messages.body:
Friday afternoon, Amanda responds

Hi, Michael!

Wow, I think you must have a direct line with the college work office! No sooner did I read your mail I got on Monday, the telephone rang, and they had a job for me! I bet it wasn't longer than 5 minutes!

It's about 5 hours a day, I have to tutor the kids of one of the professors here, and fix their supper and get them into bed. Then I have time to do my own studying, before the professor's wife gets home from her job. The kids are 3 little boys, Manny, Moe and Jack Pepp, they are 4, 6, and 7, and they are really good sweet kids, and real easy to get along with. I love them! and I even have Fridays off, so I can get this reply off to you. The pay is pretty good, too... $7.50 per hour.

I'll get my first paycheck next week, so I hope I will be able to pay the whole $300, but if not, can I pay you $200 and $100 the following week? Is that OK?

Will you let me know if this is OK to do this way, I will be waiting for mail from you.

Love, Amanda

messages.body:
Hi, Michael!

Wow, I'm really sorry this took so long! I didn't have any way to write to you, nobody where my cousin lives had a computer! Talk about prehistoric!!! But what can you do, they hardly even have a telephone! Imagine people who still use a dial telephone--no buttons, you have to turn this plastic thing on the front of it, and it takes FOREVER to connect. It was like using an antique!!

Anyway, my poor cousin finally died. They called me to come and help them sit with her, and they told me she probably wouldn't last a few days, but she sort of "got well" a little when she saw me, and we had a real nice visit, then she got sicker, and she finally died last Tuesday. They had the funeral on Friday, and it was real sad. People from all over the county came, and they were crying and everything.

Then the worst thing happened! My two uncles, Harry and Shorty, got into a fist fight at the wake, and a couple of other guys joined in, and then there was a riot! Pretty soon, there were beer bottles flying all over, and chairs, and somebody called the police! 24 people got put in jail, including me, and I didn't do anything! I was trying to get to a safe place to hide, and the cops rounded up everybody who was younger than 50! The cops didn't take Uncle Harry to jail because he's like 75, and he was the one who started the fight. Can you imagine?

I have never got into trouble before in my life, and now I have a police record, and everything! My Gramma is still mad at the policemen for arresting me. I had to pay a fine, and I'm so embarrassed! The judge said that this would be on my record for the rest of my life!!! I sure hope this won't make you want to throw me out of this deal.

Please tell me you still want me to help you get that money.

Love, Amanda

Michael, you don't know how much I missed those boys! Manny lost a tooth, and was so proud of the new one growing in already! What a cute kid, I almost cried when I saw them. I begged Mrs. Pepp for my job back, and she said she would think about it, and that the boys loved me so much, she might let me back.

That's about all for now, I hope you are doing good. WOW, it's really getting cold here. I had to put another blanket on my bed!

Love, Amanda

messages.body:
Hi, Michael!

Gosh, I didn't hear from you in such a long time, I was wondering what happened to you. Why didn't you write to me? I could sure have used a friend, something really bad happened, Gramma fell and broke her nose! When the paramedics came to take her to the hospital, they said most elderly ladies break a HIP when they fall, but she didn't, so she was really lucky, and then she started hollering at them, "SO YOU THINK I'M ELDERLY, DO YOU????"

She jumped off the stretcher, and drove herself to the hospital! So there she was, behind the wheel of her car, holding a bloody towel under her nose, and when we got to the hospital, the doctors and nurses couldn't believe it! So they got her all fixed up, and set her nose in a splint, and she's healing pretty good.

All this happened just before Christmas, so it was a funny time, with Gramma all bandaged up.

Anyway, how are you? With all the excitement around here, I forgot all about our deal. Get me up to date, will you? How's everything going with the diplomat lady?

Love, Amanda

messages.body:
Hi, Michael!

I'm really sorry I haven't replied to your mail lately. The day I was supposed to go talk to Mr. Mayer, Gramma went and this time she broke her hip, she tripped over one of the big dogs, and down she went!! I've had to stay with her in her hospital room for most of all the days, and even some nights. She doesn't want to be there and in pain, but she can't go home. I've to take care of the house and the dogs, and this is the first time I've had a chance to answer your mail.

She's been in the hospital for over a week, and now has to go to a resting home for a few weeks, the Dr. said, just so she can heal good, and not have to worry about the house and her darn dogs. I wish she didn't have them, but they're good protection for me living here by myself for a while.

I'll stop at the Western Union office on my way to the rest home to see Gramma, and talk to Mr. Mayer. Please be patient with me, I'm doing the best I can. Gramma says I would be a good nurse, and I should go to Nursing School. I don't know about that.

Love, Amanda

messages.body:
Dear Michael,

Oh, I'm so sad today. Remember I told you Gramma tripped over one of the dogs, and fell and broke her hip? Well, she went and died this morning! It's up to me and my uncle Sam to make the arrangements for her funeral. I've been crying all morning. But that's not the worst part!

Now I have to go back and live with my Mom. I am really bummed about that, and so is she. I don't think she's going to be very happy about having to pay for my education like Gramma did, but I guess she'll get over it (she'll have to, if she wants me to move out of her house as soon as I'm 18!) Then she can party with all her men friends and be a ho.

Uncle Sam says he can take the dogs out to his place, he said he can always use more guard dogs, and I told him that's about all they're good for, since they're so mean.

There's so much to do, with the funeral, and we have to sell Gramma's house and all her stuff. Uncle Sam says I can use some of that money for my education, so my Mom won't be too mad having to pay part of it. But I told him I'd rather save it up to buy a little house for myself, and get away from my Mom.

I'm sorry I can't help you. I have to live my life, and do the best I can.

Love, Amanda

messages.body:
Hi, Michael!

Things are really, really wierd around here. After Gramma died, we all went to her funeral, and as usual, my uncles got in a fight. They hate each other!! They started to drink liquor at the house, before we even went to the cemetery, and by the time we all got to the grave, they were yelling and hitting each other.

I think it's because they both were in love with the same girl, and Uncle Harry ended up marrying her, and now she wants to divorce him and marry Uncle Woody. They have 6 kids, and all of them look like Uncle Woody, so there has always been a lot of suspicion going around. They're not even brothers, so you can see, a "family resemblance" isn't there. Everybody always thought the kids weren't Harry's, but nobody says anything, and he loves them, so I guess they will be all right. At least this time we all didn't go to jail. Just Uncle Woody and Uncle Larry, but they weren't put in the same cell, that's for sure!!

Anyway, Uncle Sam sold Gramma's house and the farm, for $9.5 Million dollars! Can you BELIEVE it??? and the deal is in something they call "escrow" so it will be another week or so until I get the money. All the relatives say I should keep all the money, and not split it with them, because I stayed with Gramma. Besides, they're all really rich, so they don't need it or want it, and they think I should use the money to buy a little house away from my Mom the ho, and finish school.

After all the house-sale expenses, I should get around $9.4 million. Isn't that cool? I think so. The first thing I'm going to do is buy myself a cute little dog, one that isn't mean, like Gramma's dogs were. They scared me. Maybe they're OK at Uncle Sam's house.

So, here's the reason for my letter. I won't be helping you get out of the refugee camp. I am rich now, so I don't need your money. You should try to find somebody else to help you, 'cause I won't be the one. Good luck to you. I hope you can get out of the camp, and live a regular life.

Love, Amanda

messages.body:
Hi, Michael! 

I just got back from the Title Office, we closed the escrow this morning. The sale of Gramma's house and the land are officially closed and I got the money! Isn't that coooooool? I didn't even have to pay a RealEstate salesman a commission, because a man wanted to buy Gramma's place for a couple of years, but she didn't want to sell it, so now that she passed away, the guy jumped on it.
 
I went to the office with Phyllis Stein, (Gramma's lawyer, remember I told you how she helped me when I got in trouble at my cousin's funeral? By the way, the judge vacated the charges against me, and we just dropped the idea of a lawsuit. As it ended, I had to pay Mrs. Phyllis about $2,800 to go to court for me, but at least I won't have that on my record, that would be a serious bummer!) and we got the whole deal done in less than an hour!
 
Then we went to the bank, and talked to Miss Ann Thrope, she's real nice, and she'll be my personal banker, about my options. We looked at some investments, but I decided that the idea of just putting it all in a CD, and getting the interest to live on, would be a really smart idea for me. The interest rate is 4.5% so the money will earn me over THIRTY-FIVE THOUSAND dollars a MONTH!!! I can't believe that much money! I am just amazed, and Miss Ann says a CD is a good thing to have, and the bank will put the money to good use in the community.
 
So, as you can see, I don't need any more money, and you should really find a new partner to help you get the $15 million. Good luck.
 
Love, Amanda

messages.body:
Dear Michael,

I wasn't going to write to you again, but I have to tell you what happened.

I went to a dance at school, and I met a boy, and he is really nice. His name is Pierce Yerskine, and he's just a year older than me. He's going to the same college as me, so we have a lot in common. He's really cute, too, and he loves to dance, like me.

When we said goodbye, he asked me out on a date (I know Gramma might not like the idea of me dating a boy I just met, but she would like Pierce. He has good manners, and is polite, and everything! He's even introduced me to his mom and dad, they're real nice, too!) so he took me out to dinner, and we had a long conversation about everything under the sun!

When I told him I was writing to you, and that you have $15 million dollars that used to belong to Charles Taylor, he started laughing, and I thought he was laughing at me! I told him, "NO, it's really true, Michael's in a refuge camp, and he has a family, and all he needs is for me to send him some money to help him!"

Pierce told me that all the things you told me are LIES! It's all a scam, to try to get me to send money to you, and to think I almost sent you $8,500! You're a crook, and you have been lying to me all along. I hate you.

Quit writing to me. I'm closing this e-mail account anyway, so it won't make any difference if you write or not. Quit writing to me.

Amanda
